ratings.comment: I was a T.A, not a student, and she is a liberalist, midway between mundane and creative, 20 years ago. She displays amazing intelligence for a human , and has deciphered some truths correctly, like that humans have not evolved beyond the yeast, still stuck in Judeo-Cristian spiritualities of bread and wine, both based on yeast, sucking!
Bach is still in charge of the homework and tests, but Joseph teaches off of wiki pages and has no idea what she's doing.

Good lecturer. Knows what she's talking about; answers questions well. The biggest flaw with this class was letting Eric Bach have a say in what went on the quizzes. Some of the quizzes were unrelated to class material&the questions weren't worth thinking about as they won't be used in CS, ever. questions on all material were convoluted to the max

I thought Deb made a good effort to teach the material in a way that was easy to understand and easy to refer to in the future (using free online resources and textbooks). She does lecture a bit slow at times, but it is very clear. She's also very knowledgeable about extendedrelated topics if you talk to her after class or during office hours.
Totally chill class (although lectures get boring sometimes). Really super easy A with this prof.
Thought she was very clear in explaining the concepts and the logic was followable. Exams aren't very long so missing a few questions can set you back more.

The material is so basic and simple it really comes down to how hard they grade and exams. There were four 16-22 multiple choices quizzes and several brief HWs, as well as extra credit opportunity. Great lecturer, very clear, but as a 3rd year ECECS student I stopped showing up because much of the content is covered in other courses. Great teacher
She's an awesome professor.  If you are required to take CS240, it's worth the wait to take it when she's teaching.  Just a great person overall, really cares about the students!!

Deb Joseph is probably the worst professor I've ever had. She seems to possibly know her stuff, but is just not good at conveying it. Lectures are boring as hell, she procrastinated assigning all homework til near the end, basically screwing us all over to get the 45% we needed to pass the class. Easy A, but mental suffering along the way. 2/10

Here is my advice to anyone in CS taking 577: take it with DebJo, unless you really want to learn a lot and are willing to put in a LOT of time and energy into the course with someone else. I feel I learned a bit les than I would've with another professor, but it's just crazy easy. And DebJo is pretty helpful if you ask. Just confusing.

Take this class if all you care about is getting an A. The class is horribly unorganized and inconsistent. Her lectures are uninformative and unprepared. She is definitely one of the worst professors I have ever had. Don't even bother going to most lectures. Just do enough work for an A, which is very doable, and take that.

Horrible teacher, if you want to learn something about algorithms do not take this class with her. Only have to get 200 out of 400 points to get an A, but she routinely grades things incorrectly and enters points in wrong so you have no idea how you are doing until late into the semester.

She gave us 400 available points and said that we need 200 of those to get an A. This would have been a lot easier if the homework and quizzes had been released at a constant rate and not all at the end of the semester. Overall, really easy to get an A in this class without learning anything.

Most of the material is released when half the semester is over. Just attending lecture and passively consuming the material is a recipe for failure in this course. You have to actively work hard to make sense of things. There's a lack of clarity at times, but if you put the book, her lecture & wikipedia together it makes sense.

Is consistently late to class, moves extremely slowly, and wastes classtime by asking poorly-phrased questions with little background and not moving on until the class has arrived at the proper answer. The lectures are a complete waste of time, and she seems not to care.
A must take if you're a CS major. Highly recommended if you want to graduate.
This class is great.

Not to hard to get an A because of her point system, but you won't learn too much. What she goes over in lecture will show up on the quizzes, but is otherwise pretty useless. Homework is ridiculously time consuming, and harshly graded, but you can pick and choose which assignments you want to do. Not as bad as some of the others say.

Do not take this class with her if you actually want to learn the material.  Her grading system is that you need to get 200 out of a possible 437, so getting an A is possible but still difficult, especially since she didn't release anything until most of the semester is over.  Did not learn anything I wanted too except what I taught myself.

Definitely the worst professor I've had. Material is stumbled over during lecture, not taught. Homework assignments are not consistent with material being taught. She does not seem to be very interested in this class. Take  577 from a different professor, you won't learn anything from Joseph.
Unclear of what was expected throughout the course. Didn't respond to my multiple emails and was essentially impossible to reach outside of class.

Terrible, just downright terrible when it comes to caring about students. Lectures are absolutely unprepared. Homeworks are posted by TAs that have no idea what is covered on class. The material itself is interesting, but the class structure just burns it to the ground.

Actually pretty good at explaining things, it's just that there aren't many things to explain in her class. It's incredibly basic, and she spends way too much time going through elementary material. Got rather bored in her class.

Too disorganized to be a good professor. She once sat at the board for 15mins because she didn't know how to proceed. The class was divided in three parts (lecture/discussion/homework) that were very loosely connected. It was hard to understand what they wanted the class to do. Not too difficult of a class, but try to take it with a different prof.
Terrible professor. The material is super easy, but you are not learning anything from her. Doesn't worth the time.

I didn't learn anything and studying for the class helps very little. You literally don't know how the quizzes are tests are going to look. Her teaching style is unclear and the TA's write the tests to test you on the stuff you didn't learn. I think it's as bad as it gets. My biggest problem is she doesn't even seem to care at all about teaching.

Her lessons were incoherent, and the textbook was overly complicated. She frequently quizzed/tested us using concepts we had not learned. Ex) She introduced matrix multiplication on a quiz, a subject previously not so much as mentioned. I asked a question on the homework at one point, but she was just rude, and wouldn't answer. Very unsatisfactory.
very irresponsible about losing students' HW
Terrible teacher and very disorganized. The book she uses is useless.

One of the worst organized professors I have ever had. Lectures aren't worth going to - you'll learn everything in discussion. The TA's have no idea what is going on and are not synced up with lecture.  She doesn't ever respond to emails and tries to throw all help to the TA's. I didn't learn anything from her class, except to never take her again.
Interesting, but loses focus quickly

She's nice. It's one of those classes you either understand the material or you don't, and if you don't she's not much help. Also, her voice kind of reminds me of a cartoon character, but I can't quite put my finger on which one.

I really don't learn anything in her lectures. She just talks at us for an hour, extremely dull. Be prepared to read the text. Exams are forgiving, homework is infrequent but a little time consuming. If you're going for an easy grade, this is the class for you. If you don't feel like teaching yourself, find another professor.

Prof. Joseph seemed to dumb this class down.  Yes, 240 has a lot of freshmen, but the slow pace of this class is excruciating.  Tests are moderate, but if you study her review problems, you'll be fine.  Word of advice: if she asks a question, for the sake of the class, answer if you know, or she will wait 10+ minutes without saying a word.

Even for somebody with little to no familiarity with discrete math (just intuition), the class was horribly boring. She iterates through silly details we could have easily figured out ourselves. If you can manage to pay attention in lecture you should be fine, but that comes a challenge. Exams were pretty easy if you prepare.
The class moves mind-numbingly slowly, and lectures are boring.  Take her if you want an easy A, but don't expect to learn much.

Extremely easy. Lectures move at such a slow pace they could be condensed down to 15 minutes easily. Few homework assignment, easy tests. There is some interesting course material if you're into CS. Don't take this unless you're CS or ECE.

Other than picking an awful book, she is a good professor.  The home work is a little tough but that's because she wants you to think.  The workload in this course is nothing compared to other 500 level courses.  Lecture is usually very informative and her teaching style is easy to follow.  Recommended for anyone who wants to take algorithms.

Ms. Joseph was my advisor for several years. In that time, I was able to sit down with her ONE time. I would email, call, stop by her office, etc. She is just apathetic to everything but he own research. Eventually I found a new advisor and after talking with him and others , I found this is typical of her. She doesnt show for her classes, etc

Terrible prof. Doesn't make good use of lecture time. Course had WAY too much homework. HW was much harder than the problems done in class and was always due at the next lecture. HW grading was far too strict. Don't bother emailing her for HW help - better hope you get good TAs. I put in a lot of time but didn't learn much.

I was not fond of her teaching style. Homework was far too difficult and lengthy for the course. The grading was ruthless. Tests went back and forth between too easy and too difficult. I don't feel like I really learned much. I understand the basic algorithms, but not necessarily why they work. Class was not very instructional, more forum-like.
Lectures were so boring I couldn't pay attention.  I stopped listening after the tenth person's opinion of the problem I heard talk.  Maybe I just like being dictated to.

She is a nice professor, especially for international students because she is good and patient on explaining things when students don't understand. Her class is somewhat easy, and it is a good way to bring your GPA up.

It wasn't the easiest class in the world, I went into the final thinking I had an F.  My final grade turned out to be a B.  I don't think her teaching style is a problem, I just think the material and book are particularly vague.  I will probably take another class with her.
Don't take CS 520 or CS 577 with her. You'll get an A, but you won't learn much of anything.
Good lecturer, but her version of this class is so ridiculously easy that it's hard to learn anything from it.  CS 577 with other professors is harder but much better.
Interesting instructor, helpful, keeps the class engaged.
